com.scvngr.levelup.core.model

Class MonetaryValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scvngr.levelup.core.model.MonetaryValue
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Parcelable

    @Immutable
@NonWrappable
@LevelUpApi(contract=DRAFT)
public final class MonetaryValue
extends Object
implements Parcelable
    Represents some amount of money on the server.

    • Method Detail

      • getFormattedAmountWithCurrencySymbol

        public String getFormattedAmountWithCurrencySymbol(Context context)
        Get the formatted currency amount with symbol, assuming standard US/European "symbol+amount" formatting.
        Parameters:
        context - the Application context.
        Returns:
        the amount formatted with the currency symbol and amount (e.g. "$20" or "$23.05")

      • getFormattedCentStrippedAmountWithCurrencySymbol

        public String getFormattedCentStrippedAmountWithCurrencySymbol(Context context)
        Get the formatted currency amount with symbol, assuming standard US/European "symbol+amount" formatting; drop the last digits and decimal/comma if they're all 0s.
        Parameters:
        context - the Application context.
        Returns:
        the amount formatted with the currency symbol and amount (e.g. "$20" or "$23.05")

      • getFormattedMoney

        public static String getFormattedMoney(Context context,
                       String currencySymbol,
                       long amount)
        Helper to format a long monetary value to a string. NOTE: this is not internationalized. It assumes that the value is in "cents".
        Parameters:
        context - the Application context.
        currencySymbol - the symbol for the currency of the money.
        amount - the amount of money.
        Returns:
        String with the formatted amount.

      • getFormattedMoneyNoDecimal

        public static String getFormattedMoneyNoDecimal(Context context,
                                String currencySymbol,
                                long amount)
        Helper to format a monetary value to a string, but truncate the decimals. NOTE: this is not internationalized. It assumes that the value is in "cents".
        Parameters:
        context - the Application context.
        currencySymbol - the symbol for the currency of the money.
        amount - the amount of money.
        Returns:
        String with the formatted amount (with no decimal).
